explanations.summary: Aldosterone secretion is stimulated by: (1) High K+ (direct adrenal effect), (2) Angiotensin II (RAAS), (3) Low Na+ (via RAAS). NOT by high Na+ or Angiotensin I.

whyCorrect.b: Increased K+ directly stimulates zona glomerulosa to secrete aldosterone.
whyCorrect.d: Angiotensin II is a major stimulator of aldosterone release.
whyCorrect.f: Decreased Na+ activates RAAS → Ang II → aldosterone.

whyIncorrect.a: High Na+ suppresses aldosterone (less need for Na retention).
whyIncorrect.c: Angiotensin I is inactive; must be converted to Ang II by ACE.
whyIncorrect.e: Low K+ suppresses aldosterone (less need for K excretion).

explanations.summary: ANP effects: increases GFR, inhibits aldosterone effect, increases Na+ excretion (natriuresis). Does NOT increase Na+ reabsorption - opposite effect.

whyCorrect.a: ANP dilates afferent and constricts efferent arteriole → increases GFR.
whyCorrect.b: ANP antagonizes mineralocorticoid (aldosterone) effects in collecting tubule.
whyCorrect.d: ANP increases Na+ excretion (natriuresis) - promotes Na+ loss.

whyIncorrect.c: ANP DECREASES Na+ reabsorption, promoting natriuresis.

explanations.summary: ANH (ANP) inhibits vasopressin-stimulated water reabsorption in collecting duct. This promotes water excretion (aquaresis) along with natriuresis.

whyCorrect.c: ANP/ANH inhibits ADH-stimulated water reabsorption in collecting duct, promoting diuresis.

whyIncorrect.a: ENaC channels are aldosterone-regulated, ANP works differently.
whyIncorrect.b: Na-H exchange in PT is not a primary ANP target.
whyIncorrect.d: NKCC2 in thick ascending limb is not primary ANP target.

explanations.summary: Renin secretion is increased by: decreased renal perfusion, decreased BP, beta-1 sympathetic stimulation. NOT by excess salt or parasympathetic.

whyCorrect.c: Decreased renal perfusion is sensed by baroreceptors in afferent arteriole → renin release.
whyCorrect.d: Decreased arterial BP reduces renal perfusion → renin release.
whyCorrect.e: Beta-1 adrenergic stimulation of JG cells directly increases renin secretion.

whyIncorrect.a: Excess salt intake SUPPRESSES renin (negative feedback).
whyIncorrect.b: Parasympathetic has minimal direct effect on renin; sympathetic is key.
